desc: Analysis is a course of discovery, using advanced tools of music theory to examine the ways in which great works of music are put together. Students examine principles of form and style and, using a range of analytical techniques, come to a deeper understanding of tonal music. The course focuses on Classical and Romantic literature, with some work in 20th-centry tonality. Prerequisite: Music 214. Offered Spring Semester, 2006-07, and alternate years.
name: Analysis/Tonal Music
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Music 214. Offered Spring Semester, 2006-07, and alternate years.
title: Analysis of Tonal Music
